issue.title: Introduce `ConsoleLauncher` option to fail if no tests are run
issue.body:
As discussed https://github.com/sormuras/junit-platform-maven-plugin/issues/111

The `ConsoleLauncher` has an option to `--fail-if-no-tests`. But if there ARE tests and they're just `@Disabled` then I would expect this option to have no effect.

For cases where one wants a failure when no tests are run, I propose to include another switch `--fail-if-no-tests-run`

issue.title: Introduce `ConsoleLauncher` option to fail if no tests are run
issue.body:
As discussed https://github.com/sormuras/junit-platform-maven-plugin/issues/111

The `ConsoleLauncher` has an option to `--fail-if-no-tests`. But if there ARE tests and they're just `@Disabled` then I would expect this option to have no effect.

For cases where one wants a failure when no tests are run, I propose to include another switch `--fail-if-no-tests-run`

comment.body: My mistake. I probably got confused with parallel build output

issue.title: Assumptions should support most/all features of Assertions
issue.body:
I am trying to use something like
```
Assumptions.assumeThrows(Exception.class, () -> program.run());
```
to ignore the test if no exception was thrown.
The test should e.g. check whether cleanup/rollback is done correctly on error.

But `assumeThrows` does not exist.

The idea behind is: There is a separate test with
```
Assertions.assertThrows(Exception.class, () -> program.run());
```
that will fail if the method does not throw an exception.

If the method does not throw an exception, there should be one failing test only pointing to the problem.

-----

The idea of this feature request is to add all features of Assertions also at Assumptions.
A think this could be easily doable if we would generate the code using Assertions as source and replace all assertions by assumptions?

issue.title: Assumptions should support most/all features of Assertions
issue.body:
I am trying to use something like
```
Assumptions.assumeThrows(Exception.class, () -> program.run());
```
to ignore the test if no exception was thrown.
The test should e.g. check whether cleanup/rollback is done correctly on error.

But `assumeThrows` does not exist.

The idea behind is: There is a separate test with
```
Assertions.assertThrows(Exception.class, () -> program.run());
```
that will fail if the method does not throw an exception.

If the method does not throw an exception, there should be one failing test only pointing to the problem.

-----

The idea of this feature request is to add all features of Assertions also at Assumptions.
A think this could be easily doable if we would generate the code using Assertions as source and replace all assertions by assumptions?

comment.body: **Team decision:** `Assumptions` is intentionally simpler than `Assertions` and even only contains a subset of the assumptions that were available in JUnit 4. In light of that we don't have any plans to extend the `Assumptions` API.

issue.title: Introduce `ConsoleLauncher` option to fail if no tests are run
issue.body:
As discussed https://github.com/sormuras/junit-platform-maven-plugin/issues/111

The `ConsoleLauncher` has an option to `--fail-if-no-tests`. But if there ARE tests and they're just `@Disabled` then I would expect this option to have no effect.

For cases where one wants a failure when no tests are run, I propose to include another switch `--fail-if-no-tests-run`

comment.body: @delanym This already seems to work in the way you want for `@Disabled` test classes with at least one `@Test` method. Could you please post an example test class where it doesn't?

issue.title: ConsoleLauncher fail if no tests run
issue.body:
As discussed https://github.com/sormuras/junit-platform-maven-plugin/issues/111

The `ConsoleLauncher` has an option to `--fail-if-no-tests`. But if there ARE tests and they're just `@Disabled` then I would expect this option to have no effect.

For cases where one wants a failure when no tests are run, I propose to include another switch `--fail-if-no-tests-run`

issue.title: Parallel execution and @TestInstance(PER_CLASS) result in concurrency issues for instance fields mutated in test and lifecycle methods

issue.title: Impose an order for `@Before*` and `@After*` lifecycle methods
issue.body:
Hi all,

I just wanted  to know if there's a possibility we can impose a particular order in execution of methods annotated with `@BeforeEach`. If so, which interface should I implement or which class should I touch? 

For me it would be very useful since I use several `beforeEach` methods to improve readability of my tests.

Thanks in advance.

Regards.

comment.body: not a huge fan  cause now i need to pass TestInfo through a few hundres beforeEach calls :/

issue.title: Assumptions should support most/all features of Assertions
issue.body:
I am trying to use something like
```
Assumptions.assumeThrows(Exception.class, () -> program.run());
```

The test should e.g. check whether cleanup/rollback is done correctly on error.

But `assumeThrows` does not exist.

The idea behind is: There is a separate test with
```

```
that will fail if the method does not throw an exception.

If the method does not throw an exception, there should be one failing test only pointing to the problem.

comment.body:
@Ilpyo-Yang, the team has not yet decided to implement this proposal. 

A PR would therefore be premature at this stage.
